meanings.def: to steal money or property from a person or place
examples: The tomb had been robbed of its treasures.
The gang had robbed and killed the drugstore owner.
The tourists were robbed of their bags.
An armed gang robbed a bank in Main Street last night.
He was accused of robbing the company's pension funds.
In the 19th century doctors robbed graves to obtain cadavers for medical training purposes.

meanings.def: to cheat or trick somebody so that they lose a lot of money
examples: You can’t trust them. They’ll rob you blind as soon as your back is turned.

meanings.def: to have a sexual relationship with a much younger person
to borrow money from one person to pay back what you owe to another person; to take money from one thing to use for something else

idioms.def: to cheat or trick somebody so that they lose a lot of money
examples: You can’t trust them. They’ll rob you blind as soon as your back is turned.

idioms.def: to have a sexual relationship with a much younger person
to borrow money from one person to pay back what you owe to another person; to take money from one thing to use for something else

meanings.def: a first name for boys, short for Robert
